intro: Seseli multicaule, commonly known as the clustered seseli, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, multi-stemmed structure and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Seseli multicaule is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
